[c][00ffee]I have highlighted it's location on your Display.[-][/c]
[c][4dc3ff]Yes [i]ma'am[/i].[-][/c]\n[c][4dc3ff]Sometimes I wonder who's the Commander around here.[-][/c]

The Engineering Console in the Port side of the Crashed Titan's forward section is used by the Chief Engineer of the M.S Titan to manually operate the ship's Warp Drive.\nIt is locked to the Chief's Personal Keycard and cannot be operated without it.

[c][4dc3ff]I can see it now. It's on the [-][/c][c][00ff00]upper level[-][/c][c][4dc3ff] and looks like there's still some juice in the battery of this one.[-][/c]\n[c][4dc3ff]It probably woke up when the other console surged.[-][/c]
Access the Engineering Console on the Port side, upper deck of the M.S Titan.

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]
[c][00ffee]The Titan carried a crew compliment of 168 crewmembers, Commander.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]One of the technician's may have left their Keycard in their room.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]Good luck.[-][/c]
Search the Crew Quarters for a keycard.\nForward section of the Titan, on either side on both floors.
[c][4dc3ff]I found a Keycard in one of the engineering staff's quarters, IDA.[-][/c]\n[c][4dc3ff]Looks like i'll be able to access that console after all.[-][/c]

If you cannot access the console because you don't have a keycard: Check your ship's storage. If you are connected via Logistics to a container in your ship, any items picked up or given by the mission will be sent to your ship.\n\n[b][c][ff0000]Developer's Note:[-][/c][/b] [c][ffffff]If you've somehow managed to lose the keycard entirely, you can create a new one with the console command "give item Token 4001".[-][/c]

[c][4dc3ff]According to the reports, the crew of the Titan evacuated from the ship using the shuttles in the Titan's Hangar.[-][/c]\n[c][4dc3ff]They [i]could [/i]have a course set in the flight computers on the deck if any are left.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Marking the hangar section of the M.S Titan on your display.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]It's unlikely that anyone would have filed a flight plan while the ship was under fire, Commander.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]Noted, IDA.\nWe won't know until we look.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]Okay, i've reached the hangar section of the Titan.\nThere doesn't appear to be any transports or wreckage of them, so I guess they managed to escape.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]I'm seeing a couple of consoles in here that could still work. They all appear to be quite badly damaged though. I'll have to check them all.[-][/c]
Find and Activate a console in the Hangar

Find and activate one of the damaged consoles in the M.S Titan's hangar.\nIt's likely that none of the consoles here have reserve power or a connection for your suit. You may need to bring an external power source.
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I have marked the location of the Titan's rear section on your display along with any relevant objects and locations inside it, Commander.[-][/c]
Reach the Rear Section of the Titan
Enter the remains of the M.S Titan's rear section.
[c][8ab3ff]Okay, I've reached the Aft section of the ship. I'm gonna head in and see if I can find any active consoles, raid some lockers, dig through the trash... you know? The usual.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Yes, Commander. I [i]did [/i]notice you rummaging through Sergeant Palant's pockets back at the Heidelberg.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]I recommend searching for the Server Console. It should be located above the generator room. There's nothing for you to steal there that isn't bolted down.[-][/c]
Search the ship for the Server Room

According to IDA, the Server Room on the titan is located above the Port Generator Room.
She also disapproves of you stealing from the dead, so try to lay off taking [i]everything [/i]off the Titan's wreck.

[b][c][ff0000]Developer's Note:[-][/c][/b] [c][ffffff]All Story POIs are now indestructible as of 1.8 to prevent the mission from breaking because people kept destroying parts of the POI required for the mission, or sticking a core in the wreckage which does the same thing.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]I've found the console.\nLooks like it's already got a keycard card in it and the reserve power indicator is lit up.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]Bridge systems usually require two-factor authentication.\nI should be able to use the Server keycard and the Tech's keycard to access the bridge computers when I get up there.[-][/c]
Reach the elevator up to the bridge
[c][8ab3ff]I hate these Elevators.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]They always make me feel sick...[-][/c]
The Titan's bridge computer is completely fried. It'll require some replacement parts to get it up and running.

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Commander, the zirax have deployed several Mechanoids and a squadron of troops from transport ships.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]I have also detected the launching of bombers from the Drone Base on the other side of the planet.[-][/c]
Destroy the enemy bombers\n\n[c][ffffff]If the bombers are destroyed by a third party or turrets, you can manually complete this task by clicking the checkbox next to the objective.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]I've taken out the bombers, IDA.\nIt didn't seem like they were [i]actually [/i]trying to destroy the Titan.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]
[c][00ffee]I believe you may be right, Commander.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]The connection with the Titan's bridge system was interrupted while you were engaging the enemy.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]It's likely that accessing the Titan's systems were their true goal and the attack was a diversion.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]Did you at least manage to download the fleet logs before you were disconnected?[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I'm afraid not, Commander.\nThe files were loaded onto a physical drive and wiped from the Titan's databanks. They will not be able to transmit them in their encrypted state.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]So not only have we lost our lead on the Fleet's heading, the information has fallen into the enemy's hands.\nWe couldn't have screwed this up better...[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]The files are heavily encrypted and will take time for the Zirax to make use of them.\nWe still have a chance to retrieve them before they're decrypted and transmitted. By which point it will be too late.[-][/c]

[b][c][00ffff]Chapter 6: Hostile Apparatus[-][/c][/b]

The plan to retrieve the secure logs of the Crashed Titan failed when a zirax stealth team invaded the wreckage under the guise of an attack.
Now with the precious data that could lead to the location of the UC Fleet's survivors in the hands of the enemy, the only hope left is to invade the Communications Station and steal back the data before they can decrypt it.

[c][00ffff][b]Chapter 6: Hostile Apparatus[/b][-][/c]

The plan to retrieve the secure logs of the Crashed Titan failed when a zirax stealth team invaded the wreckage under the guise of an attack.
Now with the precious data that could lead to the location of the UC Fleet's survivors in the hands of the enemy, the only hope left is to invade the Communications Station and steal back the data before they can decrypt it.

[c][c0c0c0]* * * [-][/c]
[u][b]STORYLINE[/b][/u]
[c][c0c0c0]Prologue: Journey into the Unknown[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 1: Human Debris[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 2: A Forest of Stars[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 3: Plausible Deniability[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 4: The Cruel Stars[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 5: Offworld Grave[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Chapter 6: Hostile Apparatus[/b][-][/c]
[c][7dbff2]Can you track the zirax team that stole the data from the Titan, Ida?[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I have tracked their transmissions towards a large, communications complex not far from your position.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]It is also the only facility on the moon capable of decrypting and transmitting the data from the Titan.[-][/c]
[c][7dbff2]What can you tell me about this Communication Station and how long do you think it will take them to crack the encryption?[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]The facility has no external defenses, but is surrounded by a number of standalone [-][/c][c][ff0000]defense towers[-][/c][c][00ffee] designed for anti-air combat, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]I am unable to estimate the strength of the zirax's computer systems, so it could be an hour or a month for them to decrypt the Titan Data.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]The station itself appears to be well fortified. However, Satellite imagery from the Polaris archives indicates a great deal of traffic to an outlying com relay.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]It may contain an alternative entrance to the facility, but you may not be able to return.[-][/c]
[c][7dbff2]Understood, Ida.[-][/c]\n[c][7dbff2]I'll keep that in mind if I can't bust in through the front entrance.[-][/c]
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Plotting a course to the Communication Station Complex now.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]Good luck Commander.[-][/c]
Approach within 750 meters of the Radar Station

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Commander, The Communications Station is protected by an [-][/c][b][c][ff0000]Energy Shield[-][/c][/b][c][00ffee].[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]The only way to damage the structure is to bring down the shield with [-][/c][c][00ff00]energy weapons[-][/c][c][00ffee] and then [-][/c][c][ff00ff]destroy the shield generator[-][/c][c][00ffee] on the top or shut it down from inside.[-][/c]

Enter the Communication station's one and only door.
You can either destroy the defense towers and land outside the station or find an alternative way to the Com Station via an external teleporter.

The defense towers located around the Com Station are not shielded. However, many are equipped with anti-aircraft Flak Turrets that are designed to damage small vessels.
It is recommended that if you're going to take out the turrets that you get yourself some shields.

[b][c][ff0000]WARNING:[-][/c][/b] [c][ffffff]The Com Station is shielded with a [-][/c][c][ff00ff]Dome Shield[-][/c][c][ffffff]. Everything inside the structure will be indestructible until you disable the shield or destroy the shield generator.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Shields can be brought down with any ship-based weapon, but [-][/c][c][00ffff]energy weapons[-][/c][c][ffffff] like [-][/c][c][00ffff]Lasers, Plasma and EMP[-][/c][c][ffffff] are by far the best (Railguns are NOT energy weapons).[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]The shields will recover over time, so the only way to get rid of the shield for good is to destroy the shield generator on the top, or to enter the structure and disable the shield with a console inside the Com Station itself.[-][/c]
[c][ff5c5c]Aside from specific devices, the Com Station is indestructible. So don't even bother trying to blow a hole in the wall. Story POIs are always indestructible.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]Alright, Ida. I've reached the front entrance.\nShould I just go in guns blazing?[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]
[c][00ffee]I have no information on the internal layout of the facility.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]If you can find a floorplan of the facility or a console I may be able to direct you to where they're decrypting the data.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]Until then, you may fire at will.[-][/c]
Find a floorplan of the facility
Search the consoles in the security office for a terminal that shows you the floorplan of the facility.
[c][2eafff]Alright, i've found a floorplan on this console.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]I've uploaded it to you through my suit, IDA.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I've marked the entrance on your display, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]You will likely encounter more significant resistance in the basement levels as the mainframe is more heavily staffed.[-][/c]
Follow the waypoint to the basement level
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]On the lower level there are multiple layers of security that will require more elaborate measures to bypass.[-][/c]
There's a security console in the server room, formerly identified as Central Control by the visitor-level floorplant that will open the way to the lower levels.
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]You should be standing in front of the console, Commander.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]There should be a way to access a branch of the facility's ventilation systems from one of the other rooms.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]You should be able to close the checkpoint's shutters, forcing them to check you through manually.[-][/c]
There's a maintenance area behind the toilets to the right of the security checkpoint.
[c][8ab3ff]I've found a ladder, Ida. Checking it out now.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]There's nowhere else in this facility that can handle the Titan Data and no ships have left the area with it.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]I suggest you look around for an active terminal with a higher security clearance, Commander.[-][/c]

Look for an administrator-level terminal that contains an unclassified floorplan of the facility and says where the Titan Data was taken after it was brought here. It [i]must [/i]be somewhere on the station.

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I have found a way to bypass the Security Checkpoint, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]Were you to enter the checkpoint at present, the guard would close the door and activate the [-][/c][c][ff0000]Incinerator[-][/c][c][00ffee] that would very quickly kill you.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]There is a [-][/c][c][00ff00]circuit breaker[-][/c][c][00ffee] somewhere in the ventilation that will cut power to the checkpoint's windows.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]With the windows obscured the zirax will need to let you through to verify your identity.[-][/c]

Once in the Ventilation, find and pull the circuit breaker that controls power to the shutter windows of the observation room.
With the windows blocked, the guards will be unable to confirm your identity visually and need to open the door on the security checkpoint to conduct the check personally.

[b][c][ff0000]WARNING:[-][/c][/b] [c][ffffff]If you manually complete this task without pulling the lever, the incinerator will still be on and you'll get cooked.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I am detecting transmissions from the observation room, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]They do not appear to be [i]happy[/i] transmissions. So I would surmise that our plan was successful.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]It should now be safe to pass through the security checkpoint and engage the security personnel in the control room.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]You should then have access to the rest of the Mainframe.[-][/c]
Pass through the Security Checkpoint and eliminate the Control Room security personnel.

[b][c][2eafff][ Zirax Guard ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][ffee00]Hey guys! Someone's in the checkpoint.[-][/c]\n[c][ffee00]Whoever's there, the system is down [i]again[/i], so i'll need you to use the Intercom and read me your credentials, before I can buzz you through.[-][/c]
Kill Karlack the control room guard and clear the control room of any enemies
[b][c][ffee00][ Control Room Console ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][ff5c5c]Hey! What's going on in there?! Karlack?\nAnswer the call, Karlack![-][/c]
Someone is calling the console in the Control Room. Go and answer the call.
Find a console to open the remaining doors
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]That console seems to have done it, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]The door on the opposite side of the security room is now open.[-][/c]
Find a way through the Storage Bay
Search the storage bay for a way into the ventilation and then into the Power Room.\nThe cargo pallet in front of the ladder can be destroyed.
[c][8ab3ff]I should be able to break this vent and get into the Power Room.[-][/c]
Destroy the vent and enter the Power Room.\nEliminate the zirax personnel and access the reactor's controls.

[c][2eafff]Is that a [-][/c][i][c][2eafff]goddamned [-][/c][b][c][00ffff]FUSION REACTOR[-][/c][c][2eafff]?![-][/c][/b][/i]\n[c][2eafff]What the hell would they need one of those for in a base like this?[-][/c]
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]The rest of this floor should now be unlocked, Commander[-][/c][c][00ffee].[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]You may now proceed to the central mainframe.[-][/c]
The electronic locks to the majority of the mainframe level have been disabled. You can now progress to the mainframe's server room.
[c][84bce6]That's a lot of computers...[-][/c]\n[c][84bce6]You think they've got the Titan Data in here, Ida?[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]There is a heavily shielded area further ahead. I will be unable to communicate with you beyond this point, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]You will need to find a terminal somewhere ahead and open a dedicated connection to me.[-][/c]
The mainframe is shielded so IDA cannot provide tactical support down there.\nKeep going and you should be able to find a way to reconnect with IDA.
[c][84bce6]That's got to be the Titan Data in there![-][/c]\n[c][84bce6]There must be a way to get the doors open...[-][/c]
Access the turbine control panel and overload the turbines to force the emergency procedures to open the doors.

With the turbines overloaded, they've allowed access to the Mainframe's Central Computer.\nIn this secure clean room is the Terminal being used to decrypt the Titan Data so that it can be transmitted to the Zirax High Command.
Access the terminal and cancel the decryption process and remove the Titan Data.
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Commander, I have opened the door to the control system.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]All that's left for you to do is pull the lever.[-][/c]
Disable the mainframe's protections, Commander. End this!
[c][ffee00]Internal Partitions Removed! System Intrusion Detected![-][/c]\n[c][ffee00][b]< Initiating System Purge >[/b][-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Zirax forces will attempt to retake the Facility and Mainframe soon, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]I believe it would be best if you were not there when they arrive.[-][/c]
Return to the Elevator and escape the Communications Station

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]
[c][00ffee]There seems to be a problem, Commander.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]I can't seem to find any more of the Main Story Missions within the scope of the game! It seems the developer is still working on it.[-][/c]

[b][c][2eafff][ Commander ][-][/c][/b]
[c][ffffff]What the hell are they doing?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Oh right, it's just one guy doing [i]everything[/i].[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]So let's give a big thank you to [-][/c][c][ff5c5c]Vermillion[-][/c][c][ffffff], Forgemaster; Builder of POIs; Writer of the Stories; Balancer of Builds and all-round good guy![-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00]Chapter 1: Unlawful Possession[-][/c][/b]

IDA has identified a message hidden within data transmissions from the Polaris Com Relays to Kenex Station from the time that it was under Pirate control.

It seems that a certain individual has left contact information meant for you.
Perhaps it's time we give this so-called pirate a call?

[b][c][ffee00]Chapter 1: Unlawful Possession[-][/c][/b]

IDA has identified a message hidden within data transmissions from the Polaris Com Relays to Kenex Station from the time that it was under Pirate control.

It seems that a certain individual has left contact information meant for you.
Perhaps it's time we give this so-called pirate a call?

[c][ff0000][b]WARNING[/b]!! The Pirate Story Missions may negatively impact your reputation with Polaris or Traders.[-][/c]
[c][ff5c5c][b]Note[/b]: Depends on player performance and skill.[-][/c]

[c][c0c0c0]* * *[-][/c]
[u][b][c][ffee00]PIRATE STORYLINE[-][/c][/b][/u]
[c][00ffff]Chapter 1: Unlawful Possession[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 2: Cloak and Dagger[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 3: Inside Job[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 4: Assault and Battery[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 5: Rival Syndicate[-][/c]
[c][c0c0c0]Chapter 6: A Debt To Pay[-][/c]
[c][80ffff]Are you sure you want to abort this mission? Please confirm your choice.[-][/c]\n\nYou can start the mission via PDA (F1) at any time.

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I've filtered the transmissions from Relay 451 to Kenex Station and found a communications frequency in the final transmission hidden in the metadata.\nI believe it's intended for you.[-][/c]

[c][2eafff]Open a channel, IDA.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff]I wanna see who this guy is and what he wants.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff][-][/c]
[c][2eafff]Make sure it's a [i]secure [/i]channel. I don't like eavesdroppers.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff]You're probably right, IDA.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff][-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]Let's check out Kenex Station's Cargo Bay.[-][/c]
Go to Kenex Station's main terminal and cargo bay in the Starting orbit.

[c][2eafff]Well, we're here.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff][-][/c]
[c][2eafff]There's a lot of cargo here and I can't go through it all while we're being watched.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff]Can you find which box we need, IDA?[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I have located several dozen containers that may contain the box that we're after, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]I have also found a security log that shows that a suspected pirate was captured by station security.[-][/c]

[c][2eafff]I think we'd have better luck asking Markos' guy than blindly going through the containers one by one.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]Can you plot a marker to where they're keeping the prisoner?[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I have added the location of the Security Office to your HUD, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]It is three floors above you; accessible with the main elevator.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff]Yep, that looks like our guy.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]I guess i'd better speak to the man in charge first...[-][/c]
Speak to the Security Officer in charge
Speak to the Security Officer and convince him to let you speak to the prisoner
[c][2eafff]I guess everyone at Polaris will take a bribe if they can get away with it.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]The Logistics Office that the prisoner mentioned is on the floor below, above the trading floor.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]As a member of Polaris, you already have access to the room.[-][/c]
The package is in a container several floors down, next to an exterior hatch.
[c][2eafff]I think we may have a problem here.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]There's security everywhere and no way to grab the package without someone seeing me.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff]IDA, open a channel to Markos.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]There's no way I can grab this package without my reputation being shot with Polaris.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff]Well, it's this little white box.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]As soon as I grab it, all hell will break loose.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]Any suggestions IDA?[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I'm afraid I can provide no answers for you, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]The system will not allow me to adjust the cargo manifest. So any actions you take will have to involve user error or "dumb luck" as you would put it.[-][/c]

Markos has sent you to obtain a white box from this [b][c][ffffff]Cargo Pallet[-][/c][/b].
If you open the container, Polaris will identify you as a pirate or thief and your reputation with them will be ruined.
The choice is yours...

[b][c][ff0000]WARNING!![-][/c][/b]
[b][c][ff5c5c]Due to a bug in the item detection system, you are required to SKIP this objective after you've obtained the package. If you DON'T have the package when you go to hand it in, you will be killed and your inventory deleted.[-][/c][/b]
[c][2eafff]I'd better get to somewhere safe, where I won't be disturbed or overheard before contacting Markos...[-][/c]
Manually check this objective to contact Markos and receive further instructions on delivering the package.
[c][2eafff]IDA, open a channel to Markos.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]It's time to report on the mission's success.[-][/c]
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I have received the location data from Markos, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]However, I am detecting no energy signatures from the site.[-][/c]
[c][2eafff]They could just be running silent.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]Wouldn't be very good pirates if they can't sneak up on their prey, would they?[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]Let's go say "Hello", IDA.[-][/c]
Markos has sent you the location of his ship.\nYou are to bring the goods retrieved from Polaris holding to his ship.
[b][c][ffae00][ Markos ][-][/c][/b]\nThat's my ship you're looking at. Pretty ain't she?\nNow land on the top deck and come up to the bridge.
[b][c][ffae00][ Markos ][-][/c][/b]\nDon't try anything funny, either.\nShe's pretty, but she's also armed and if you do anything wrong i'll be taking back my cargo from your smoldering wreck.
Land on the top deck as instructed and enter through the Airlock
[b][c][ffae00][ Markos ][-][/c][/b]\nBring the package to the bridge.
The Red Rogue's First Officer is Vespian.\nYou'll find him on the Bridge outside the Captain's Room.
Enter the Captain's Room and speak to... Markos?
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]I do not recommend getting involved with pirates, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]Consorting with known criminals is against UCH naval code.[-][/c]

[c][2eafff]Well, IDA.[-][/c]\n[c][2eafff]This isn't really under UCH jurisdiction and it [i]might[/i] just get us closer to our goal if we can get some extra eyes and ears out there in the galaxy.[-][/c]
[b][c][ffffff]Data Package:[-][/c][/b] [b][c][00ffee]CPU Management[-][/c][/b]\nInformation on Reforged CPU Management is being downloaded to your PDA (F1)

[b][c][ffffff]Package Information:[-][/c][/b]\nThis data package was queued up by [c][ffee00]I.D.A[-][/c] when CPU Extenders or Warp Drives are unlocked in the Tech Tree.\nThese files have been added to your Empyriopedia to better educate you on the nuances of the CPU system and the modular expansion of ship technology to meet your needs.
[b][c][ffffff]Data Package:[-][/c][/b] [b][c][00ffee]Shield Combat[-][/c][/b]\nInformation on shields and kinetic resistance is being downloaded to your PDA (F1)

[b][c][ffffff]Package Information:[-][/c][/b]\nThis data package was queued up by [c][ffee00]I.D.A[-][/c] when you unlocked Gatling Cannons in the Tech Tree.\nThese files have been added to your Empyriopedia to better educate you of the effects of kinetic weapons on shields.

[b][c][ffffff]Shields:[-][/c][/b]
Shields are defensive countermeasures employed by a variety of vessels and structures designed to deflect or absorb the impacts of conventional kinetic weaponry and explosives; reducing their damage to a structure by consuming power and a catalyst (Pentaxid).
While shields will protect from any weapon, they are highly resilient to [c][ffffff]kinetic weapons[-][/c] such as [c][ff5c5c]Miniguns, Cannons, Flak Shells, Rockets, Missiles, Railgun Slugs[-][/c] and [c][ff5c5c]Artillery Shells[-][/c].
Conversely, shields are highly susceptible to damage from [c][ffffff]Energy-based weapons[-][/c] such as [c][6bd600]Lasers, Plasma, Positron Beams, Electromagnetic Pulse Weapons, Antimatter Torpedoes[-][/c] and[c][6bd600] Ion Cannons[-][/c] that will quickly deplete shields under sustained fire.

The majority of Zirax weaponry consists of energy weapons. However, in order to operate in any atmosphere, their weapons possess lower accuracy, speed and lose a great deal of energy in thermal output. This makes their lasers easier to dodge for faster crafts and deal less shield damage than the weapons of Polaris, Kriel or the UCH but more versatile.

[b][c][ffffff]Shield Boosters:[-][/c][/b]
A recent advancement in shielding technology has lead to the development of shield modulation technology. In the past, shields were a fixed thing. You would use a shield and it would provide total protection.
With the advent of the Shield Booster technology, it's possible to improve the strength or charging speed of your shields. They do come at a cost however as the devices draw power while the shield is charging and are quite heavy.
[b][c][00ff00]Shield Capacitor:[-][/c][/b] Increases the strength of your shields, but reduces the speed at which they recharge slightly.
[b][c][ffbb00]Shield Charger:[-][/c][/b] Increases the recharge speed of your shields, but reduces their strength slightly.

[b][c][ffffff]Contact Surfaces:[-][/c][/b]
A ship is comprised of many moving parts, and many of those parts are in contact with high energy ejections, such as weapons and thrusters. These provide a constant drain on the energy a shield generator needs to use to operate.
In order to prevent the shields from draining from the plasma of thrusters or the force being imparted on the barrels of weapons, energy buffers are included in such devices that consume power from the shield generators without impacting their performance.
[b][c][dd0000]Thrusters (CV):[-][/c][/b] Reduce shield capacity by 5 for each thruster
[b][c][dd0000]Weapons (CV/BA):[-][/c][/b] Reduce shield capacity by 25 for each conventional weapon and 50 for each energy weapon
[b][c][dd0000]Weapons (HV/SV):[-][/c][/b] Reduce shield capacity by 10 for each conventional weapon and 15 for each energy weapon

[b][c][ffffff]Obtaining Advanced Shields:[-][/c][/b]
Shield Generators are upgraded from the lower grade to the higher grades using a Multitool set to the Upgrade Mode. Shield Generators can similarly be downgraded using the Downgrade function.
You must have the correct Shield Generator unlocked in your Tech Tree and the materials to upgrade in your inventory or in a connected container.

[b][c][00ffee][u]CPU Restrictions:[/u][-][/c][/b]
Every structure has a pre-set limit of CPU that the Core uses to run your ship's systems. If you exceed the maximum CPU limit, you will begin to take penalties to your efficiency that will negatively affect your ship's performance in several aspects.
Thrusters will produce less thrust, Generators will output less power, Weapons will take longer to reload, Turrets will turn slower and Constructors will function at reduced speed.
This is particularly dangerous in combat as reduced power output will cause your generators to overheat and begin to take damage and eventually explode while accelerating.
Building blocks do NOT consume CPU.

[b][u][c][00ffee]CPU Extenders:[-][/c][/u][/b]
As you run low on CPU, you can suppliment your Core's default CPU amount with Extenders that will consume power to output additional CPU and increase your CPU limit roughly equal to the core itself.
The amount of CPU given from each Extender is shown on the extender block itself, so the more extenders you have, the more CPU you will get in much the same as generator or oxygen or fuel tank usage. [c][ff0000]There are [i]no[/i] CPU Tiers[-][/c].
Unlike with the default game, if you lose a CPU Extender, your ship is not instantly crippled, followed by all the generators exploding. You lose only the CPU that extender represented; reducing your efficiency if you were close to the limit, but nothing more.

[b][c][00ffee][u]Building for Efficiency:[/u][-][/c][/b]
Bigger is better. Larger thrusters are more CPU, Power, Mass and Space-efficient over multiple smaller thrusters; The same rules apply to generators, oxygen and fuel tanks.
Focus your ship's function into a single role. It's better to do one or two things really well, than trying to win a fight carrying everything you own slowing you down and making every fight a nightmare as even the smallest amount of hull damage may lose valuable cargo.
[b][c][ffffff]Data Package:[-][/c][/b] [b][c][00ffee]Mass and Volume[-][/c][/b]\nInformation on [c][2eafff]moving large objects[-][/c] is being downloaded to your PDA (F1)

[b][c][ffffff]Package Information:[-][/c][/b]\nThis data package was queued up by [c][ffee00]I.D.A[-][/c] when you set to craft an oversized object such as a Turret or Large Constructor.\nThese files have been added to your Empyriopedia to better explain how to move and place objects larger than your personal carry capacity.

[b][c][ffffff]Note:[-][/c][/b] This Data Package is automatically downloaded when you craft a Large Constructor, Sentry Guns or Projectile Turrets.
[c][ff5c5c]This information is not relevant for those who have disabled Mass and Volume Settings.[-][/c]

You've got yourself your first LARGE objects that you cannot fit into your personal inventory.
If you're wondering how you're going to fit that abnormally large [c][ffffff]Constructor [-][/c]or [c][ffffff]Minigun Turret[-][/c] into your inventory and place it on your base; this Data Package will tell you how to use the Logistics System.

First thing is to connect the input/output your Constructor to a Cargo container on the same structure (Does not include your Portable Constructor) using the menu on the left side of the Constructors Interface.
For players using the Portable Constructor, you will need to link to a base or ship's logistics system with a container on it to transfer the overly large block to the container (explained below).

[b][u][c][00ffee]Logistics System:[-][/c][/u][/b]
The Logistics System is used with the [c][ffffff]F4 Key[-][/c] and will allow you to access any structure's cargo logistics system that you are in range of.
You will find a "Wifi" symbol on your display that will light up if you are in range of a structure's logistics system. This will work on any owned structure you are within 4 meters of, regardless of whether it has power or not.

With the Logistics window open, select the container you want to move objects from on the right side and click the button in the middle of the screen that looks like an "[c][ffffff]Electric Plug[-][/c]". This will connect your toolbar to that container.
By taking the large devices (Large Constructor, Turrets, etc...) from the container into your [c][ffee00]yellow connected toolbar[-][/c], you can now place that item from the connected toolbar as if it were in your inventory.
You can switch between your Connected Toolbar and your Regular Toolbar with the [c][ffffff]"T" Key[-][/c].

[b][c][00ffee][u]Looting with Logistics:[/u][-][/c][/b]
While connected to a container anything you salvage, retrieve or pick up will be automatically deposited into the connected container. Allowing you to pick up items off the ground that are too large to fit in your inventory and place objects directly into storage without cluttering up your inventory.

[b][u][c][00ffee]Wifi Range:[-][/c][/u][/b]
You can increase the range that you can connect to a Logistics Network with a [c][2eafff]Remote Connection[-][/c] Block. This increases the range of the attached structure's Logistics Range by 50 meters, centered on the Remote Connection Block.
