[b][c][ffffff]Data Package:[-][/c][/b] [b][c][00ffee]Supporting Reforged Eden & Galaxy [-][/c][/b]has been successfully installed to your [c][ffffff]Empyriopedia (F1)[-][/c]
There's a Datapad sitting next to a container in the Heidelberg's cargo hold that's emitting a faint energy signature

[c][8ab3ff]I can see the constructor. The logs should be on a terminal on the front of the machine.\nI might need the [-][/c][c][0088ff][-][/c][b][c][00ff00]Jetpack [-][/c][/b][c][0088ff][-][/c][c][8ab3ff]on a suit of [-][/c][c][0088ff][-][/c][b][c][00ff00]Light Armor [-][/c][/b][c][0088ff][-][/c][c][8ab3ff]to reach them...[-][/c]

There are inconsistencies between the logs left behind by Ensign Emmerson and Sergeant Palant and the physical evidence at the scene.\nInvestigate the Heidelberg's constructor logs to reveal the truth.

[b][c][fbff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00e1ff]It would be best to approach in the times between regular drone patrols, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00e1ff]If they cannot help us, it would cause unnecessary problems for them if we were found in their presence.[-][/c]

[b][c][fbff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00e1ff]It seems you may be right, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00e1ff]Nonetheless, these creatures were not described in the Heidelberg's logs and should be investigated for potential information.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]This place looks like somewhere you'd find the leader of a village.\nLet's go in and say "hello"[-][/c]
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00e1ff]They're preparing to breach, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00e1ff]Get back by the power terminal, away from the Red Console![-][/c]
Take cover by the Power Terminal
Get away from the Red Console and take cover by the Power Terminal
[c][8ab3ff]I think it's about time I got some answers...[-][/c]
Meet with the Huntmaster to bring in the young hunters suspected of selling me out to the Zirax.

[b][c][ffff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffff]From the information the Chief provided, I was able to pinpoint the station he described.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffff]It stands in an a heavily industrialized area with steady activity from a spaceport.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]Plot a course to the structure Ida.\nWe're finally one step closer to finding the rest of the Fleet...[-][/c]
[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00e1ff]Correction.\n[i]You [/i]are there, Commander. I am simply observing your surroundings using the sensors on your suit.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]It's good to see modern Civilization, even if it's not my own.\nLooks like it's got all the usual amenities of home.[-][/c]

Polaris Employee [c][ffae00]8376455466[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]- Routing data packet 72858-A to your display[-][/c]
Please read the [c][4dc3ff]Terms and Conditions[-][/c] before accepting.

As of an hour ago, A cargo freighter registered to the Trade Federation carrying sensitive supplies from [c][0088ff]InterWeapon[-][/c] [c][ffa000](A subsidiary of Polaris Megacorp)[-][/c] suffered engine trouble on entry into the atmosphere and was forced to set down outside the [c][ffbb00]Polaris Exclusion Zone[-][/c].

As the freighter is carrying restricted technology ([u]not[/u] illegal) discovery of the freighter's cargo by Imperial Authorities will cause political issues between the Zirax Empire and Polaris Megacorp subsidiaries that would be best avoided.

As a Polaris Contractor you are tasked with [c][ffffff]locating the freighter[-][/c] and assisting them in [c][ffffff][u]any capacity[/u][-][/c] to get them back to the Polaris Exclusion Zone around the Trade Station.
In the event that hostile forces attempt to capture or inspect the freighter, [c][ffffff]your secondary mission is to repel them with visible and overwhelming force[-][/c].

[c][ffae00]Location coordinates are included in this data packet.[-][/c]

[sub]Polaris Megacorp and all of it's subsidiaries are not liable for personal or private damages incurred as a result of the contracted mission. Nor will it reimburse claims of: Disfigurement, mutilation, loss of life, loss of limb, alien parasites, excess body hair, bad hygiene, erectile dysfunction or light to severe radiation poisoning.[/sub]
Board the ship and find the captain
Find the ship captain on the bridge
[b][c][ffff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffff]The mission data says you are required to board the ship and report to the Captain on the bridge.[-][/c]
According to Captain Orli, his Engineer is working on a broken landing gear outside the ship, next to the boarding ramp.
[c][0088ff]Pretty sure I passed the Engineer outside, on the way to the boarding ramp.[-][/c]

The Engineer of the Diomese requires a list of components to repair the ship's landing gear. It's currently sending false readings to the ship's computer, preventing it from taking off.

The components requested are:
[c][00ff00]50 Steel Plates[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]30 Mechanical Components[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]48 Electronics[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]20 Plastic Tubing[-][/c]
[c][00ff00][-][/c]
[c][ffff00][b]Bring them to the Engineer with ALL the items in your inventory[/b][-][/c]

[b][c][ffff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffff]The list of items the Diomese's Engineer requested have been added to your PDA [-][/c][b][c][ffffff](F1)[-][/c][/b][c][00ffff], Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffff]You can find them by selecting the current active mission and task.[-][/c]
The Captain is upstairs on the bridge of the Diomese
[b][c][00ffff][ Captain ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][ffff00]Oy, you lot![-][/c]\n[c][ffff00]The 'zax 'av sent some ships this way ta hit us. So get yer asses inside and ready ta go on tha double![-][/c]
[b][c][00ffff][ Captain ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][ffff00]Here they come![-][/c]\n[c][ffff00]Polaris-guy, get on those guns an' shoot 'em down![-][/c]

The Diomese's Manual turret controls are located in the Core Room at the rear and Forward Computer room.
There's a holographic interface on the underside of the turrets that you can interact with to activate the turrets and take manual control to destroy the attacking bombers.

[c][ff0000][b]The turrets will not fire on their own. You must aim and fire them yourself.[/b][-][/c]
You've completed the job, now you need to report back to Administrator Pavrell and get him to tell you where the rest of the UCH Fleet went after striking a deal with Polaris.
[c][8ab3ff]This looks like the right place.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]Hopefully the Medical Officer can shed some light on the conditions of the survivors.[-][/c]
Speak to the station's Medical Officer
Ask the Ok'y Medical Officer about Ensign Emmerson

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00e1ff]The Polaris Security dock is located at the top of the station, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00e1ff]There aren't many operators on duty while there is no ship currently in port. So it should be easy to get in without being stopped by security.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00e1ff]There is an active PolSec Terminal on the boarding level.[-][/c]\n[c][00e1ff]The operator appears to handle crew placement on outgoing vessels and would be the one most likely to be able to access the crew logs.[-][/c]
You've hit a dead end in your search for the UCH survivors.\nIDA wants you to speak to the Kenex-62 Coms Chief for some reason.
[b][c][ffff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][66ccff]I have plotted a course to the first relay on the list, Commander.[-][/c]
You'll need to enter the Com Relay and approach the center of the room to progress.
[c][8ab3ff]Okay, i'm inside the relay.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]What am I looking for?[-][/c]
Access Code for Communication Relay 588's Airlock is [c][00e1ff]7046[-][/c]

[b][c][ffff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][66ccff]Coms Chief Mason sent the code to your PDA, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][66ccff]You can access it with [-][/c][b][c][ffffff]F1[-][/c][/b][c][66ccff] and then select the currently active task to see the relevant data.[-][/c]
Access Code for Communication Relay 451's Airlock is [c][00e1ff]4076[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]Chief, I can confirm that there are hostiles onboard the relay.\nThey don't have a ship here, so i'll dock and take them out before they can call it back.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]I'm back at the relay, chief.\nThe place is a mess. The pirates look like they've been here for a while and even have crates of supplies.[-][/c]
The pirates who took over Com Relay 451 must have their own terminal or datapad that should detail what they've done and what they were after on relay 451.

[b][c][ffbb00][ Coms Chief [-][/c][/b][b][c][ffae00]Mason [-][/c][/b][b][c][ffbb00]][-][/c][/b]\n[c][cacaca]First things first: See if you can find anything the pirate's left that'll say what they were doing in there.[-][/c]\n[c][cacaca]If we know what they did, it should be possible to undo.[-][/c]
Use the console in the center of the room to open the hatch to the datacore using the code [c][00ffff][b]1332[/b][-][/c].
[c][8ab3ff]I've got a visual on Relay 451.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]Something's not right here. The airlock lights are showing red.[-][/c]
Access Code for Communication Relay 451's Airlock is [c][00e1ff]4076[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]Ida, what was the airlock code again?[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]Oh... right.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]It should still be saved on my [-][/c][c][ffffff]PDA[-][/c][c][8ab3ff].[-][/c]
Return to the PolSec level of Kenex station and speak to Coms Chief Mason about your job well done.
[c][80ffff]Are you sure you want to abort this mission? Please confirm your choice.[-][/c]\n\nYou can start the mission via PDA (F1) at any time.
[c][8ab3ff]I've reached an entry point into the Wreckage, Ida.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]Looks like this leads through the Crew Quarters towards the Warp Drive near the bow.[-][/c]
There's probably a keycard somewhere in one of the technician's bunkrooms. Search the floor and cupboards.
[c][8ab3ff]Looks like i've found one of the technician's rooms.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]There could be a keycard in here somewhere...[-][/c]
Return to the Port-side of the Titan's Engineering section and insert the Keycard into the Engineering Console on the upper floor.
[c][8ab3ff]The safety of the fleet lies in our hands, IDA.\nLet's not screw it up this time...[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]I've spotted a security terminal that could work, Ida.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]This facility's shield will protect devices from destruction. In order to progress the defenses will need to be disabled with the terminal in the security office.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]The code to disable the shields and open the door is [-][/c][b][c][00ff00]8842[-][/c][/b][c][00ffee], Commander.[-][/c]

There's a security terminal in the office next door.\nApproach it and enter the code [b][c][00ff00]8842[-][/c][/b] to open the door into the main building and disable the base's shields, allowing you to destroy vents, sentry guns and spawner pads.
[c][8ab3ff]External defenses should now be down and the door open.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]All that's left is to deal with a military facility staffed by an army of soldiers.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]
[c][00ffee]There's a troublesome object I should draw your attention to, if you haven't already destroyed it, Commander.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]There's device on the ground in the other room.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]If you have destroyed it, please confirm it on your PDA (F1)[-][/c]

[b][c][ffff00]If you have destroyed the pad already, click the checkbox next to the task objective to manually complete the task.[-][/c][/b]
[b][c][ffff00][-][/c][/b]
Approach the pad on the floor of the lobby.
These Spawners are one-way teleporters used to teleport troops in to reinforce locations.

[c][00bb00]Spawner Pads have a set number of troops that can be deployed at a time.[-][/c]
[c][66ccff]When any troop is killed, a replacement will be spawned after a one minute delay between the previous spawn.[-][/c]
[c][ff5c5c]If there is a dead body or an obstruction (e.g. you) on the spawner pad, it will be unable to initialize until the area is cleared.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Devices like this are a one-way receiving pad for teleportation used mainly by the Zirax Empire.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]They will continue to deploy reinforcements through these pads until they are disabled or destroyed.[-][/c]

Reach the Generator room through the door on the far side of the Mess Hall.

[b][c][ff0000]Developer's Note:[-][/c][/b] [c][ffffff]Do NOT attempt to jetpack to the second floor from the mess hall.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Sorry, but that's not allowed and you'll have to go all the way back to advance the mission.[-][/c]
[c][ff5c5c]Also, you'll probably die by jumping straight up there.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]The output of these generators does not match the power usage of the entire base. There may be an auxillary power source somewhere not listed in the floorplan.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffff]The door on the far side of the mess hall will send you towards [-][/c][c][00ff00]Central Control[-][/c][c][00ffff] where they are likely holding the Titan data.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffff]I will mark destinations as you progress, Commander.[-][/c]
Follow the corridors to the crew quarters.\n[c][00ff00]There is a Medbay on the right side of the corridor where you can heal and respawn in the event of your death.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]There is a [-][/c][b][c][ff0000]Medbay[-][/c][/b][c][00ffee] through the door on the right side of the corridor, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]You may want to use it to recover from any injuries you have sustained.[-][/c]
Taking things to the next level
Follow the corridors and rooms to reach the staircase to the next floor.\n\n[c][ff5c5c]Make sure you destroy all spawner pads as you go or else reinforcements may appear behind you.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffee]Once you go up those stairs to the upper floor, you will be exposed with little cover so keep low.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffee]This is why I did not recommend boosting up there from the mess hall, Commander.[-][/c]

Across the open balcony on the upper floor is the Central Control's server room. If anywhere on the floorplan is likely to house the Titan data, it would be there.\n\n[c][ff5c5c]There are rooms off each side with enemies in all of them. It's recommended that you clear them all before entering Central Command.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]There must be something wrong here, Ida! [-][/c][c][8ab3ff]This looks like a server room.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]I don't seen anything here that could decrypt the Titan's Data.[-][/c]
Approach the console and enter the code [b][c][00ff00]6103[-][/c][/b] to open the elevator doors into the sub-basement level and the Xenu Mainframe.
[c][8ab3ff]I've entered the code, Ida.[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]The doors to the lower level should be open now.[-][/c]
[c][8ab3ff]I hope you've got a way to avoid that, Ida?[-][/c]\n[c][8ab3ff]I'd rather my goose [-][/c][i][c][8ab3ff]not [-][/c][/i][c][8ab3ff]get cooked today.[-][/c]
Press Ctrl to crouch into the vent
[c][ffffff]Press [-][/c][b][c][00ff00]C[-][/c][/b][c][ffffff] to crouch and enter the vent[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ Mainframe Announcement ][-][/c][/b]\n[b][c][00ffee]Attention all personnel! We have an intruder in the Security Control Room![-][/c][/b]\n[b][c][00ffee]All security forces on duty are to engage the intruder![-][/c][/b]

[b][c][ffff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffff]I don't think they believed your bluff, Commander.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffff]However, their reinforcements have opened one of the doors and there should be another console that opens more doors.[-][/c]
The door on the opposite side of the guard room where you answered the call has been opened by the console switch in the observation room.

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]
[c][00ffee]There appears to be a second power room somewhere nearby.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]It also looks like they've locked the doors ahead to stall our progress.[-][/c]
[c][00ffee]There should be another way around through the [-][/c][c][ffff00]storage bay[-][/c][c][00ffee].[-][/c]

[b][c][ffff00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00ffff]That would explain the difference in power output I was detecting earlier.[-][/c]\n[c][00ffff]But you are right, Commander: for a facility this size to have a fusion reactor is overkill.[-][/c]
[b][c][ff0000][ Zirax Commander ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][ffff00]You're too late, Terran![-][/c]\n[c][ffff00]Surrender now and you shall be given the honor of a quick death.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffff00]ATTENTION ALL PERSONNEL: EVACUATE[-][/c][/b]\n[c][ffbb00]The Auxillary Plasma Turbines have exceeded safe parameters[-][/c]\n[c][ffbb00]All doors in the facility have been unlocked for your safety[-][/c]

[b][c][ffee00][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00e1ff]There appear to be many complaints about him in the private messages of the station's personnel.[-][/c]\n[c][00e1ff]I'm detecting a large amount of traffic from the Administrator's terminal, but my access is blocked by a high-order AI.[-][/c]

You have found the source of the mysterious subspace signal. Perhaps this was sent out as a warning by the former inhabitants of this world.
Here you will find information on the galaxy.\nThe UCH has put together a brief overview of the different star systems you can expect to encounter in the Andromeda galaxy.
You download the logs from the beacon.\nYou should investigate the sector.
Your sensors pick up a radiation cloud nearby. Maybe worth investigating.
The logs mentioned a radiation surge. Scan the nearby radiation clouds.
You have discovered the source of the signal.
Detecting high levels of ionizing radiation, possibly due to a Promethium fuel leak.
Detecting high levels of non-ionizing radiation, perhaps due to weapons fire.
You find an old ion trail, most likely caused by a damaged engine.
Your scanners are being calibrated with the energy signatures you detected in the radiation clouds.
Calibration complete. Detecting an ion trail.
The ion trail may lead to exhaust gas.
Your scanners detect two distinct mixtures of exhaust gas from different ships. Using this you can pinpoint the origin of the beacon.
Your scanners detect a strong presence of both mixtures of exhaust gas nearby. This should be the source of the distress beacon you discovered earlier.
You find the source of the distress beacon.

Based on stellar drift and radiation patterns, your computer has calculated a possible origin position for the beacon.

After calibrating your scanners, you are able to detect an old ion trail from the same ship as the warp trail you discovered earlier.
The ion trail is stronger here and you are able to calculate the probable location of its source.
Your scanners have pinpointed the source of the signal beacon.
You find the source of the signal beacon.

[c][b4e1ff]You need to find out the state of Terran forces in Andromeda. Find a [-][/c][c][00afff]UCH Research Vessel[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] in space and make contact. You will need a warp capable Small Vessel or Capital Vessel, depending on the distance you need to warp.[-][/c]

[c][00afff]UCH Research Vessels[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] can be found in the [-][/c][c][00ff00]Alpha[-][/c][c][b4e1ff],[-][/c] [c][00ff00]Beta[-][/c][c][b4e1ff],[-][/c] [c][00ff00]Delta[-][/c][c][b4e1ff], and [-][/c][c][00ff00]Epsilon[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] starting systems, or randomly in some [-][/c][c][00ff00]habitable (G, F, A)[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] star systems in neutral territory. They appear on the solar system map as a [-][/c][c][00afff]blue triangle[-][/c][c][ffffff].[-][/c]
[c][b4e1ff]Completing this mission will unlock additional missions and more entries in the [-][/c][c][00ff00]Project Eden Empyriopedia [-][/c][c][ffff00]({keybind(PDA)})[-][/c][c][ffffff].[-][/c]

[c][ffffff][i]These objectives can be manually completed if needed.[/i][-][/c]
Are you sure you want to skip? You can activate the mission again from the PDA.

[c][b4e1ff]Find a UCH Research Vessel and approach it.[-][/c]
[c][00afff]UCH Research Vessels[-][/c] can be found in the [c][00ff00]Alpha[-][/c], [c][00ff00]Beta[-][/c], [c][00ff00]Delta[-][/c], and [c][00ff00]Epsilon[-][/c] starting systems, or randomly in some [c][00ff00]G-class[-][/c] star systems. They appear on the solar system map as a [c][00afff]blue triangle[-][/c].

[i]These objectives can be manually completed if needed.[/i]

[c][b4e1ff]You need to find out the state of Terran forces in Andromeda. Find a [-][/c][c][00afff]UCH Research Vessel[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] in neutral space and make contact. You will need a warp capable Small Vessel or Capital Vessel, depending on the distance you need to warp. Research Vessels are visible on the solar system map as a [-][/c][c][00afff]blue triangle[-][/c].\n\n[c][b4e1ff]Check the PDA [-][/c][c][ffff00]({keybind(PDA)})[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] for details.[-][/c]
[c][b4e1ff]Approach the [-][/c][c][00ff00]Quartermaster[-][/c] on the main deck of the research ship.\n\n[i]These objectives can be manually completed if needed.[/i]

[c][b4e1ff]Approach the [-][/c][c][00ff00]Captain[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] located on the bridge in the aft section of the ship. To reach the bridge, take the aft door in the main deck until you reach the elevator in the engine room. Go up the elevator.\n\n[i]These objectives can be manually completed if needed.[/i][-][/c]
[c][ffffff][i]Incoming message:[/i][-][/c] Please proceed to the main deck and speak with the quartermaster.

Welcome to our research vessel. Please familiarize yourself with the mission of Project Eden by approaching some of the crew. You can speak with them by looking at them and pressing F for additional information. They may have valuable insights.\nPlease speak with the Quartermaster on the main hangar deck.
The [c][00ff00]Quartermaster[-][/c] buys and sells equipment and schematics.
The [c][00ff00]Captain[-][/c] sometimes offers additional insights into the status of the Terran forces in the Andromeda Galaxy.
Now you should make your way to the bridge and speak with the captain. The bridge can be accessed from the elevators in the hallway behind the research lab.

[b][c][ffffff]Location:[-][/c][/b] [c][00ff00]Delta System[-][/c]

[c][b4e1ff]Welcome to Project Eden, recruit! You are now prepared to explore the rest of your starting solar system and beyond.
Remember that you will need a [-][/c][c][00ff00]Capital Vessel[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] with a warp drive to warp to another star system.
It's always good practice to keep an extra stash of supplies for emergencies. Always have enough Pentaxid for a round trip before warping. [-][/c][c][ffff00]Don't get stuck![-][/c]

The [-][/c][c][00ff00]Empyriopedia[-][/c][c][b4e1ff] section of the PDA contains useful information and answers to frequently asked questions about the game and scenario.[-][/c]

[c][b4e1ff]You can also sometimes find missions or other hints by talking to individuals. Try speaking with the lead researcher or the captain if you haven't already.

[c][ff8000]Please see the [-][/c][u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1703779262][c][00afff]Project Eden Configuration Guide[-][/c][/url][/u][c][ff8000] on Steam for [b]important information[/b] on using Project Eden on a dedicated server or for customizing it! [-][/c][c][ffff00][u]You must follow the directions in the guide for your server to function correctly.[/u][-][/c]

If you have a question not answered here please leave a comment on the Workshop!

[c][00ffff]Do the default missions work?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]No. Reforged Eden does not contain any of the missions from the vanilla game.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]The Reforged Galaxy story missions usually only work on the planets listed as having Reforged missions.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Note that only the Beginner, Temperate, Arid, and Swamp starting planets are set up to work with the Reforged starting missions.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]You can find the Beginner and Temperate starting planets in the Alpha system, while Arid and Swamp are in the Beta system.[-][/c]


[c][00ffff]How do I complete the custom missions?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Check the description of the mission. Some may have you collect an item or visit a specific planet type and you may have to warp to other star systems to complete it. Some missions use a combination of some or all of the PDA, tokens, and dialog.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Most mission objectives can be obtained in multiple places in case you lose the item or otherwise can no longer complete the mission from a particular POI. Those that use unique POIs can either be repeated in the POI or can have the objectives manually marked as complete.[-][/c]


[c][00ffff]I completed a mission and nothing happened. What now?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Many of the custom missions and story is still a work in progress. Alpha 12 completely changed how missions and storytelling can be done so it required a rewrite of the PDA. If you find any unique items, hold on to them because they might have a purpose. More is planned to be added later on.[-][/c]


[c][00ffff]I lost an important mission item. What do I do?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Most of the important mission items can be obtained again, either from the same source you first found it at, or from another version of the POI somewhere else in the galaxy. For those that can only be obtained once, you can manually mark the mission objective as "complete".[-][/c][c][ffffff][-][/c]
[c][ffffff]If you are well and truly stuck, leave a comment on the Workshop and I can help you out.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]

If you have a question not answered here please leave a comment on the Workshop!

[c][00ffff]Where do I find X resource?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Once you complete the mission "Make Contact with Terran Forces" you will get new sections added to the Empyriopedia in the PDA that describe the different star types.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Titanium is found on colder planets such as snow and Neodymium is found more often on dry arid or desert planets. There will always be enough resources in your starting system to build a warp capable capital vessel, but you may have to do more exploring to find advanced ores.[-][/c]

[c][00ffff]Why can't I find Titanium on my starting planet?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]In general, resources in Reforged Eden are more spread out and harder to obtain. Depending on your chosen starting planet, you may have to build a warp capable small vessel using Iron, Silicon, Copper, and Cobalt to warp to another planet. You will always find the resources to build a warp capable small vessel in your starting sector, and a warp capable capital vessel in your starting solar system.[-][/c]

If you have a question not answered here please leave a comment on the Workshop!

[c][00ffff]Where do I post my comments or feedback?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]You can leave a comment on the Workshop page for the scenario.[-][/c]


[c][00ffff]I found a bug or problem with the scenario, where should I report it?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]First check the Workshop page to see if it's already a known issue. [-][/c][c][ffffff]If you found a problem not listed there, there are two ways to report it depending on if it's possibly a problem with the scenario or a bug with the game itself.[-][/c]

[c][ffff00][b]If you think it's a problem with the scenario:[/b][-][/c][c][ffffff][-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Leave a comment on the Workshop under one of the pinned discussions or in the general comments with as much detail as possible about the issue. Things to include are the seed, exact planet and star system name, the exact name of the mission, POI, or NPC, and a clear description of what the problem is.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]
[c][ff8000][i]Issues with the scenario might be things like a Continue or Quit error when you try to warp to another star system, errors in the console referencing PDA, POI, or deposit spawns, POIs that aren't placed correctly (buried, etc) or that fall apart due to SI, errors with the PDA, dialog, or traders, texture issues on planets, or any other issue that you cannot reproduce in a default survival game.[/i][-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]
[b][c][ffff00]If you think it's a game bug:[-][/c][/b]
[c][ffffff]First reproduce the issue in a default game.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]To do this have Steam verify file integrity, then start a new save game using the default survival scenario and try to reproduce the problem there.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]If you are able to reproduce, make a bug report on the official Empyrion forums following the directions they provide.[-][/c]
[c][ff0000][i]It's important that the devs be able to reproduce the issue in the default game as they cannot offer support for modded content.[/i][-][/c][c][ffffff][b][u][/u][/b][-][/c]

[i][c][ff8000]Issues with the game might be things like crashing in the main menu, holes into the void or floating grass on planets, AI problems with NPCs, drones, or patrol vessels, the motorbike launching you to orbit, UI errors such as problems with inventory management, etc.[-][/c][/i]

If you have a question not answered here please leave a comment on the Workshop!

[c][ff8000]Please see the [-][/c][u][u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1703779262][c][00afff]Project Eden Configuration Guide[-][/c][/url][/u][/u][c][ff8000] on Steam for [b]important information[/b] on using Project Eden on a dedicated server or for customizing it! [-][/c][c][ffff00][u]You must follow the directions in the guide for your server to function correctly.[/u][-][/c]


[c][00ffff]Does Reforged Eden work in COOP?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Yes it does work, but you may encounter problems.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]16gb of computer memory is strongly recommended for COOP, but it is generally best to run a true dedicated server instead.[-][/c]


[c][00ffff]Does Reforged Eden work on a dedicated server?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Yes Reforged Eden should work with dedicated servers.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Reforged Eden uses the full galaxy generation so keep in mind the size of the game world will be immense as it's meant to be played solo, COOP, or on dedicated servers for small groups.[-][/c]


[c][00ffff]Why is the loading time longer?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]When initially loading the scenario, the game has to generate the fixed sectors and this can cause loading to take longer than normal.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]

[c][00ffff]Is there any customization I can make to the scenario for my server?[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]Yes. You can feel free to edit any of the scenario's configuration or playfield files as you see fit, but [u]doing this is at your own risk[/u]. I cannot offer support for using customized configurations with the scenario and some things can break your save game.[-][/c][c][ffffff][-][/c]
[c][ffffff]There is also a Project Eden Admin Control you can access from within the game. See the configuration guide for how to access.[-][/c]

[b][c][00ffff]Tips for navigating the solar system and galaxy map:[-][/c][/b]

Use the filters on the left side of the screen.
On the right side there are several tabs depending on which map screen you are in.
There is a hint screen for the solar system map. Click on the "?" icon in the upper left to learn more.

You can check info on planets, moons, and sectors by clicking on a star in the galaxy map, or a planet, moon, or sector in the solar system map and using the various tabs on the right side of the screen.
[c][ffff00]Always check info before entering a planet in case there are hazards you need to be aware of such as high gravity or other dangers.[-][/c]
[c][ffff00][-][/c]
You can speed up your camera movements in the galaxy map by holding a combination of [c][ffff00]SHIFT [-][/c]and [c][ffff00]CTRL [-][/c](depending on your keybindings). You can use the [c][ffff00]WASD, C, and Space [-][/c]keys to move forward, backward, left, right, up, or down to get a better view of the entire galaxy while holding [c][ffff00]Left Mouse[-][/c].


[b][c][00ffff]Terminology:[-][/c][/b]
[c][00ff00]Sun[-][/c]: The central star of a solar system. You cannot warp to a star directly.
[c][00ff00]Planet[-][/c]: A rocky body you can typically land on. Contains an orbit and sometimes one or more moons.
[c][00ff00]Gas Giant[-][/c]: A special type of planet that cannot be warped to or landed on directly. Instead you can warp to each of its moons.

[c][00ff00]Moon[-][/c]: A rocky body you can typically land on that orbits a planet or gas giant.
[c][00ff00]Orbit[-][/c]: The area of space around a planet.
[c][00ff00]Sector POI[-][/c]: Areas of space that lack a planet in the solar system, such as asteroid fields or standalone Trade Stations[c][00ff00].[-][/c]

[c][00ff00]Playfield[-][/c]: An area of the game world. A planet is its own playfield, as is a moon and a space orbit. Going from planet to orbit means you enter a new playfield.
[c][00ff00]Sector[-][/c]: Any location on the solar system map that you can warp to. A sector encompasses a planet, its orbit, and any of its moons. A standalone asteroid field can also be a sector.

[c][00ff00]Solar System[-][/c]: An object on the galaxy map containing a star with various planets and sector POIs. Can also be referred to as a [c][00ff00]Star System[-][/c], [c][00ff00]System[-][/c], or [c][00ff00]Star[-][/c]. Star type influences what you will find there.
[c][00ff00]Nebula[-][/c]: A gaseous cloud located within a galaxy. Can show up in space but otherwise has no effects currently.
[c][00ff00]Galaxy[-][/c]: The entire game world seen in the galaxy map containing thousands of stars. Can also be divided up into multiple galaxies.
[c][00ff00]Faction Territory[-][/c]: This can refer to the faction territory displayed on a planet's surface, or on the faction territory on the galactic map. Galactic faction territories influence which factions will be found within that territory.
Planetary territory can be gained or lost by NPC factions. Galactic territory is static.

[c][00ff00]Kilometer[-][/c] ([c][00ff00]km[-][/c]): Unit of measurement within a playfield. 1,000 meters. 1 BA/CV block is 2x2x2 meters in size for reference. Standard propulsion can cover this distance.
[c][00ff00]Astronomical Unit[-][/c] ([c][00ff00]au[-][/c]): Unit of measurement within a solar system. 1au is the average distance between the Sun and the Earth. A short range warp drive mounted on a small vessel can warp 15au. A long range warp drive on a capital vessel is required to go further.
[c][00ff00]Light Year[-][/c] ([c][00ff00]ly[-][/c]): Unit of measurement on the galaxy map. 1ly is the distance light travels in one year in a vacuum. A long range warp drive on a capital vessel is required to warp between solar systems.
Barren worlds such as these are a good source of [c][00ff00]Sathium [-][/c]needed to build long range warp drives and combat steel for capital vessels.
Barren worlds such as these are a good source of [c][00ff00]Sathium [-][/c]needed to build long range warp drives and combat steel for capital vessels.
A barren planet. Barren worlds such as these are a good source of [c][00ff00]Sathium [-][/c]needed to build long range warp drives and combat steel for capital vessels.
Barren worlds such as these are a good source of [c][00ff00]Sathium [-][/c]needed to build long range warp drives and combat steel for capital vessels.

If you haven't already, speak to the captains of the other UCHN research ships in the other nearby star systems. I'm sure they could use some help as well.

A tutorial message will appear momentarily.
Wait for the tutorial to finish.

You have completed a warp to another star system. Congratulations on leaving your starting solar system!

When you warp to other stars, you end up in one of 6 [c][00ff00]hidden warp arrival sectors[-][/c] near the star. These sectors cannot be selected or warped to directly and building there is disabled. You can only return to these sectors by warping in from another star system from the correct direction or by placing a waypoint using the registry and then warping directly to that waypoint.

[c][ff0000]Always make sure you have enough [-][/c][c][00ff00]Pentaxid[-][/c][c][ff0000] and other supplies![-][/c]
[c][ffff00]It is strongly recommended that you do not leave any ships behind in this sector as it can be difficult to return.[-][/c]

"[c][00ffff]Project Eden:[-][/c] [c][ffffff]The Galaxy[-][/c]"
Wait for the tutorial to finish.

You have arrived in the star cluster known as Decay.
This area of space is a work in progress and not complete yet.

You are free to explore it, but you will have to bring resources with you through the warp gate.
You will need your [c][ff8000]Progenitor Translation Key[-][/c] created from research at UCH Research Vessels.

[c][ffffff]Also...[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][i]You're being watched.[/i][-][/c]
Wait for the tutorial to finish.
New Empyriopedia section unlocked in PDA [c][ffff00]({keybind(PDA)})[-][/c]:\n"[c][00ffff]Project Eden:[-][/c] [c][ffffff]Hacking and Research[-][/c]"

[c][abd1ff]Throughout your travels in some areas of space you may encounter alien Data Caches, Relays, or other hackable structures.

These structures are invulnerable and you must solve a puzzle of some kind to get inside of them. You won't always succeed. Sometimes you have a limited time or number of attempts before the structure self destructs or shuts down.

Often you can find special loot.[-][/c]
This section explains how hacking and research works.
[c][ffff00][u][b]WARNING:[/b][/u][-][/c] Approaching Kriel blockade!\nTurn back now to avoid ship destruction.
[c][ffff00][u][b]WARNING:[/b][/u][-][/c] Approaching Kriel blockade!\nTurn back now to avoid ship destruction.

Throughout your travels in some areas of space you may encounter alien Data Caches, Relays, or other hackable structures.\n\nThese structures are invulnerable and you must solve a puzzle of some kind to get inside of them. You won't always succeed. Sometimes you have a limited time or number of attempts before the structure self destructs or shuts down.

[c][abd1ff]Many hackable objects will contain various data chips. These chips can be turned in to the lead researchers on UCH Research Vessels.

Turning in data chips will reward you with credits and research points. Obtain enough research points and you can create various items.
Research points are not shareable between players, but you can give all your data chips to one person to turn in.[-][/c]
Find the [c][ff0000]Red[-][/c] Key Card somewhere in the ship.

[b][c][fafe10][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]
[c][00fbff]While you've been busy fiddling around with that armor, I was able to hack into some of the ship's database.[-][/c]
[c][00fbff]It looks like they have sealed the main exit with 2 key cards. You will need to find those key cards if you are going to escape.[-][/c]
[c][00fbff]Prepare yourself for a fight. I doubt they will simply let you walk out of here.[-][/c]
[b][c][fafe10][ IDA ][-][/c][/b]\n[c][00fbff]You've obtained one of the key cards you need.[-][/c]

[b][c][ffffff]Location:[-][/c][/b] [c][00ff00]Decay Star Cluster[-][/c]
[b][c][ffffff]Difficulty:[-][/c][/b] [c][ff0000]Hard[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][i]This mission is unlocked after traveling through the Ancient Warp Gate.[/i][-][/c]

The Decay cluster is full of ancient and dead stars.
Too far for standard communications, you will need to establish a communications relay to make contact with UCH Command.

Establish a small space station near the Ancient Warp Gate on the Decay side of the Decay-Andromeda gate to act as a communications relay.
You will first need to place down a [c][00ff00]Base Starter[-][/c] block and then add the following to it:
[c][00ff00]1x Generator[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]1x Fuel Tank[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]1x Antenna[-][/c]
[c][00ff00][-][/c]
You will need to bring resources and a [c][ff8000]Progenitor Translation Matrix[-][/c] with you through the gate.
Establish Communications Relay at Decay Gate
Place an antenna on your new base.

[c][ffffff][b]Incoming transmission:[/b][-][/c] Hello? Ca-[i]crrrkkk[/i]-you hear me? We've Boo-[i]zrrrkk[/i]-sted the signal but it-[i]crrkkk[/i]-low.
Ah, you made it to Decay. Tr-[i]zrrrkkk[/i]-what happen-[i]zrrrkkk[/i].....
[i][c][ffffff]You believe UCH is asking you to investigate the Decay star cluster to find out what happened to the Progenitors.[-][/c][/i]
[i][c][ffffff]You will likely also need a [-][/c][c][ff8000]Progenitor Translation Key[-][/c][c][ffffff] from a UCH Research Vessel.[-][/c][/i]

UCH Command has asked you to investigate what happened to the Progenitors in the Decay star cluster.\nYou should find a Progenitor Interface on one of their planets. You will also need a [c][ff8000]Progenitor Translation Key[-][/c] from a UCH Research Vessel if you don't have one already.
Land on any of the Decayed planets in the Decay star cluster

Find a Progenitor Interface on a Decayed planet in the Decay star cluster and download the data to your PDA.
Progenitor Interfaces show up on the planetary map.

You will also need a [c][ff8000]Progenitor Translation Key[-][/c] to access the interface.
The Progenitor Interface should show up on the map as a distinct signal. Find it and see if you can access it.
The Progenitor Interface should show up on the map as a distinct signal. Find it and see if you can access it.

You have received a warning message addressed directly to you from the Progenitors. Whether some of them survived or if it's just an advanced form of AI you do not know.\nEmbedded in the data you've collected are hidden codes. You should transmit them to UCH Command.
Return to the Decay side of the Decay-Andromeda gate and transmit the data you obtained to UCH Command using your communications relay station.
Warp to the Decay-Andromeda Gate and return to your communications relay station on the Decay side of the gate to transmit your data back to UCH Command.

[c][ffffff][b]Incoming transmission:[/b][-][/c] You found something? Do you really-[c][ffffff][i]crrrkkk[/i][-][/c]-a good idea? Embedded data? Yes we will get to work decod-[i][c][ffffff]zzrrrpp[-][/c][/i]-ing that right awa-[i][c][ffffff]zrrrkk[-][/c][/i]-. Transmite the data and give us a few moments and we -[c][ffffff][i]crrrkkkk[/i][-][/c]-contact you momentarily. UCH Command-[i][c][ffffff]crrkkzzzkk[-][/c][/i].\n[i][c][ffffff]It seems UCH Command wants you to wait a few minutes while they decode the data.[-][/c][/i]
Stay in the sector and wait for UCH Command to finish decoding the data.
Wait for UCH Command to transmit the decoded data back to you.
Return to the Decay side of the Decay-Andromeda gate to receive the transmission from UCH Command.
You transmit your data to the actual UCH Command. Unfortunately whoever you first sent the data to can probably guess where you'll be going next. Best to watch your back...

[c][97e1ff]You need to find out the state of Terran forces in Andromeda. Find a [-][/c][c][00afff]UCH Research Vessel[-][/c] in space and make contact. You will need a warp capable Small Vessel or Capital Vessel, depending on the distance you need to warp.

[c][00afff]UCH Research Vessels[-][/c] can be found in the [c][00ff00]Alpha[-][/c], [c][00ff00]Beta[-][/c], [c][00ff00]Delta[-][/c], and [c][00ff00]Epsilon[-][/c] starting systems, or randomly in some [c][00ff00]G-class[-][/c] star systems. They appear on the solar system map as a [c][00afff]blue triangle[-][/c].
Completing this mission will unlock additional missions and the [c][00ff00]Project Eden Empyriopedia [-][/c][c][ffff00]({keybind(PDA)})[-][/c].

[c][ffffff][i]These objectives can be manually completed if needed.[/i][-][/c]
Your sensors detect a UCH research ship in this sector.
Approach the UCH Research Vessel in this sector.
Place down a Base Starter block while near the Decay-Andromeda gate.
Place a Generator on your new base.
Place a Fuel Tank on your new base.
Start by crafting 50 Large Fuel Packs. Remember that it creates 2 per crafting job, so you only need to queue up 25 crafting jobs.

[c][00ffff][b]Location:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Polaris Mining Operations around D class stars in Polaris or Neutral territory[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Difficulty:[/b][-][/c] [c][00ff00]Easy[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Repeatable:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Yes[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Objectives:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Craft 50 Large Fuel Packs (25 crafts) and deliver them to a Mining Quartermaster onboard a Polaris Mining Foreman vessel[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]
One of our mining operations is running low on fuel. If you could craft 50 fresh Large Fuel Packs and deliver them to the Mining Quartermaster on board Mining Foreman vessels in one of our mining operations, we would pay you a fair price.
Please note that the Mining Quartermaster is extremely picky and will only accept freshly energized fuel packs and they inspect them upon delivery, so don't try to pass off old fuel packs you found in your cargo hold.

You can find Polaris Mining Operations in some D or M class systems. They appear on the solar system map as an orange triangle and will specify that they are a Polaris Mining Operation in the map description. But they won't be in every system.
You can also rarely find a Mining Foreman in orbit around planets in G class star systems.

[c][ffff00]Don't try to mine the asteroids there as they are claimed by Polaris Megacorp.[-][/c]
Place 50 Large Fuel Packs in inventory.
Place 50 Large Fuel Packs in your personal inventory to transfer them to the Polaris Mining Quartermaster.

[c][00ffff][b]Difficulty:[/b][-][/c] [c][00ff00]Easy[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Repeatable:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Yes[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Objectives:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Craft 50 Large Fuel Packs (25 crafts) and deliver them to a Mining Quartermaster onboard a Polaris Mining Foreman vessel[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]
One of our mining operations is running low on fuel. If you could craft 50 fresh Large Fuel Packs and deliver them to the Mining Quartermaster on board Mining Foreman vessels in one of our mining operations, we would pay you a fair price.
Please note that the Mining Quartermaster is extremely picky and will only accept freshly energized fuel packs and they inspect them upon delivery, so don't try to pass off old fuel packs you found in your cargo hold.

You can find Polaris Mining Operations in some D or M class systems. They appear on the solar system map as an orange triangle and will specify that they are a Polaris Mining Operation in the map description. But they won't be in every system.
You can also rarely find a Mining Foreman in orbit around planets in G class star systems.

[c][ffff00]Don't try to mine the asteroids there as they are claimed by Polaris Megacorp.[-][/c]
Start by crafting 50 Large Fuel Packs. Remember that it creates 2 per crafting job, so you only need to queue up 25 crafting jobs.

You have the fuel packs. Now you need to find a Polaris Mining Foreman vessel in a Polaris Mining Operation. You can find them in Polaris Mining Operations around D or M class stars in neutral or Polaris territory. Look on the solar system map for an orange triangle.
Are you sure you want to skip? You can activate this mission from the PDA at any time.

So you got on the bad side of Polaris Megacorp? We are willing to... Forgive... Your past transgressions.
We can raise your reputation to neutral... For a price.
Obtain 250,000 money cards and be ready to transfer them to us. Then we will no longer consider you an enemy of Polaris... For now. Consider this a second chance.

[i][c][ffffff]This mission will subtract 250,000 money cards from your player inventory as soon as you have them.[-][/c][/i]
[i][c][ffffff]This mission is intended if you have an unfriendly or hostile reputation with Polaris and can only be completed twice.[-][/c][/i]
[c][ffffff][i][/i][-][/c][c][ff0000]Only activate this mission if you are sure you want to pay Polaris Megacorp 250,000 credits.[-][/c]
I thank you for contributing to my retirement fund. You are no longer considered an enemy by Polaris, but you better be on your best behavior from now on.

[c][ff0000]Are you sure you want to pay Polaris Megacorp 250,000 credits?[-][/c]\n[c][ffffff][i]This mission will raise your reputation to neutral, can only be completed twice, and cannot be undone.[/i][-][/c]
Warp to the Dyson Sphere System in the center of the Decay star cluster

You transmit your data to the actual UCH Command. Unfortunately whoever you first sent the data to can probably guess where you'll be going next. Best to watch your back...Inside the data you transmitted, UCH Command has found mention of a larger structure near the middle of the Decay star cluster. This might possibly be a Dyson Sphere.\nYou should find this Dyson Sphere and warp to it.

You arrive at the Dyson Sphere. A Dyson Sphere is created so a civilization can harness all of the power of a star. Whoever built this colossal structure must have been more advanced than humans by millions of years.
You should warp to each of the observation points around the sphere to take scans of the structure and find a way in.

[i][c][ffff00]Be prepared for anything. You don't know who else is looking...[-][/c][/i]
Warp to Sphere Observation Point 1 in the Dyson Sphere System in the Decay star cluster.
Warp to Sphere Observation Point 2 in the Dyson Sphere System in the Decay star cluster.
Warp to Sphere Observation Point 3 in the Dyson Sphere System in the Decay star cluster.
Warp to Sphere Observation Point 4 in the Dyson Sphere System in the Decay star cluster.
Warp to each of the 4 Sphere Observation locations within the current system.
You take a scan of this side of the sphere.
You take a scan of this side of the sphere.
You take a scan of this side of the sphere.
You take a scan of this side of the sphere.

During your scans you detected several anomalies just under the surface of the outer shell of the dyson sphere. The energy signature is consistent with that of the portal technology used at the warp gate. Perhaps further investigation of Progenitor structures in the Decay star cluster will reveal a way inside?
[c][ffffff][i]This mission ends here but is a work in progress.[/i][-][/c]\n[c][ffffff][i]More will be added in the future.[/i][-][/c]

Is this thing on? ...He-hello? Please, there's not much time. You have to listen to me! We tried to escape! We tried to leave but it was too late. Our fate was not caused by a natural event! Beware the...

To anyone listening... It wasn't natural. The radiation that burned our world didn't come from our sun like we thought. We discovered evidence that this happened to other planets. May this serve as a warning.
We picked it up on long range radar years ago, but we didn't know what it was until it was too late. A black sphere, glowing with an eerie greenish light...

Is anyone out there? Help us, please. We thought it was a natural geological event. We waited but the volcanic activity never subsided. That's when we picked it up, on the other side of the sun. An object, of unknown origin emitting gravitational waves to destroy our planet.

We thought the artifact was going to be our undoing. It drove us to madness. Pitting sister against sister and nation against nation. We were wrong. The artifact merely attracted something far worse. It came to destroy the artifact, and us.

We had no choice. Our planet was being torn apart by a madness that spread like an infection. We had to launch the nukes. We had to... Oh Ashriz, what have we done? Please, if there's anyone reading this message... You are not alone. They are coming.
Bring Fuel Packs to Mining Quartermaster
Speak with Quartermaster with Fuel Packs in inventory

Speak with the Mining Quartermaster on board a Mining Foreman vessel. You can find them in Polaris Mining Operations around D or M class stars in neutral or Polaris territory. Look on the solar system map for an orange triangle.\nMake sure to have 50 Large Fuel Packs in your personal inventory.

Speak with the Mining Quartermaster on a Polaris Mining Foreman vessel.\nYou can find them in Polaris Mining Operations around D or M class stars in neutral or Polaris territory. Look on the solar system map for an orange triangle.

You wake up inside a virtual reality simulation. To save bandwidth, not every experience was saved to memory.
These are the last living moments of a soldier who lived long ago.

Speak to the lab technician to get oriented.

Clear the Artillery Station of all hostiles. Re-arm the Artillery Station using Artillery Shells found in cargo boxes near the Artillery Station.\nUse the artillery turret to destroy one of the smaller green spheres along the bottom of the larger black spheres.

You have discovered the source of the mysterious signal. It appears to have been broadcasting for hundreds, perhaps thousands of years. Perhaps they intended it to be a warning to other civilizations.

This machine appears capable of interfacing with the Human mind. You can use it to experience memories from a time long ago. Consult the interface panel nearby for more information and then enter the portal when you are ready.

[c][ffff00]WARNING: make sure you are well equipped before entering the simulation![-][/c]
[c][ffffff][i]This mission takes place inside an instance. Upon entering, a new version of the playfield is generated and maintained until you leave it or the time limit expires. Group members will have 2 minutes to enter the same portal as you. You may make multiple attempts but will have to start over each time.[/i][-][/c]
Pay your respect to the fallen soldier Korvas at his grave on the planet Maveth. You can find the grave slightly East of the Ark.

Someone must have dragged Korvas's body out of the ruins of the Ark and buried him. Perhaps they also implanted a message in the neural interface leading you here.

Instinctively, you reach under part of the casket and find a schematic for the [c][ff8000]Incendiary Minigun[-][/c] so you can craft your own ammunition for it or replace it if it becomes damaged.

This grave must have been dug sometime after the battle. This means there were survivors. Perhaps their descendants are still out there.
Mentally exhausted from your time in the simulation, you prepare to leave this planet. Whatever destroyed this civilization might return one day and the galaxy must be prepared.
You suddenly get a strong urge to travel slightly East. Perhaps there is something more to find.\nSee if there is anything to the East. Whatever it is, it must be close by.
Find the source of the mysterious subspace signal on Maveth
Find a central control room inside The Ark on the planet Maveth
You have awoken from the virtual reality simulation and get your bearings. Whatever happened to these people, you vow to not repeat history.
Find the source of the signal on Maveth.

\nYou have found the source of the signal. It appears to be an abandoned structure of a technologically advanced civilization. There appears to be battle damage. Your sensors have pinpointed the source of the signal to be in the bottom level of the structure. Find the source of the signal.
The captain hands you an [c][ff8000]Incendiary Minigun[-][/c] to help clear the Artillery Station of hostile forces. Use the ammo sparingly!
How to survive your starting planet

Your priorities and needs can vary depending on your choice of starting planet and game difficulty options. This is just general guidance.

First, make sure your immediate surroundings are safe then read over any [c][00ff00]starting mission text[-][/c] (if there is any) and the information in the [c][00ff00]planet description[-][/c]. You can usually get a good idea of what you need to do based on those two things.

Next you will need to find some Iron Ore if you didn't start with a [c][00ff00]Portable Constructor[-][/c]. On some planets this can be a challenge and you will have to travel far before you find your first iron. Once you've built a [c][00ff00]Portable Constructor[-][/c] you can use it to convert [c][00ff00]Crushed Stone[-][/c] into basic ores.
Food can be obtained from wild [c][00ff00]plants [-][/c]and [c][00ff00]animals[-][/c], or from your starting missions.
If you are on a planet without oxygen, you will also need to set up a [c][00ff00]O2 Condenser[-][/c] to obtain oxygen.

Some planets can have [c][ff0000]dangerous wildlife[-][/c], [c][ff0000]soldiers[-][/c], or [c][ff0000]drones [-][/c]hunting you, or[c][ff0000] extreme environments[-][/c] with radiation, temperature, or weather hazards. Check the planet description for any warnings.
You will need to think of creative solutions to dealing with the obstacles that you face. Some general hints:

[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]Some wildlife will run away when damaged. Use this to keep them away from you.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]Pay attention to tooltips on wild plants. Some can cure ailments, but may cause food poisoning in the process.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]Headshots deal more damage, especially against humanoids.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]If you have a jetpack, hiding on top of a rock can give you temporary safety from predators.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]Drones can be intimidating enemies, but shooting them can disorient them and aiming for the red dot deals bonus damage. Pistols, assault rifles, and especially sniper rifles are more effective against drones than your shotgun or survival tool.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]You can use the player drone to mine, scout, or retrieve a lost backpack.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]The Survival Tool can harvest surface rocks, mine, damage enemies, and salvage blocks or devices, but it does these things poorly.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]Promethium can sometimes be difficult to find but you can substitute bio fuel to power your ships.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]Solar power is not effective on all starting planets.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]Using the Fresh Start option will spawn you back on your original starting planet, but will not remove any of your reputation, levels, structures, or bank account balance. This can be used as a last resort if you die and cannot respawn in a safe location.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]Consider setting up some early game blueprints in creative mode tailored to your starting planet. Note that some starting planets forbid use of the blueprint factory.
[c][ffff00]-[-][/c]You will usually only find basic resources on your starting planet, enough to build a Small Vessel. You will need to travel to other locations to build more advanced ships.

Most starting planets only contain the basic resources needed for a starter Small Vessel. In order to build more advanced ships, you will need to travel elsewhere.
Note that availability of resources will vary depending on your chosen starting planet.

First you will need a basic [c][00ff00]Small Vessel[-][/c] with either an enclosed cockpit or an airtight interior. The Small Vessel also needs thrusters in all 6 directions to be space worthy. You can build such a ship with resources found on your starting planet.

Next you will need [c][00ff00]Cobalt[-][/c] either from Cobalt Asteroids found in orbit of your starting planet, or from Cobalt Deposits on the nearby moon. Cobalt will allow you to construct a [c][00ff00]Short Range Warp Drive[-][/c] and a [c][00ff00]Pentaxid Tank[-][/c] for your Small Vessel.
This will allow you to warp to the other locations in your starting solar system.

It is highly recommended, but not required, to complete the [c][00ff00]Solo [-][/c]mission [c][00ffff]Make Contact with Terran Forces[-][/c] at this time. This mission will introduce you to the UCH forces in Andromeda and give some nice rewards.

Once you have built a warp capable Small Vessel, you will be able to travel to locations within the same star system to gather more resources.
To warp to other stars you will need to build a warp capable [c][00ff00]Capital Vessel[-][/c] from resources found in the starting system.

In addition to the basic resources and Cobalt you've already found, you will need:
-[c][00ff00]Titanium[-][/c], from [c][00ff00]Snow [-][/c]planets or an [c][00ff00]Asteroid Field[-][/c].
-[c][00ff00]Neodymium[-][/c], from [c][00ff00]Arid [-][/c]or [c][00ff00]Desert [-][/c]planets or an [c][00ff00]Asteroid Field[-][/c].
-[c][00ff00]Sathium[-][/c], from a [c][00ff00]Barren[-][/c] planet or [c][00ff00]Barren[-][/c] moon.

You can also find many of these resources from various wrecks throughout the starting star system, or by purchasing them from traders.

Once you have a warp capable Capital Vessel, you can open the galaxy map, select a star within warp range, and warp to it to continue your journey in Project Eden.

There are some locations that are occupied by dangerous enemies or that have extreme environmental hazards.
Approaching these locations without being prepared can mean a quick death for yourself and loss of your ship.

Always look at the description of a sector, planet, or moon before entering it. You can view descriptions on the solar system map using the various checkboxes.

This is by no means a complete list of dangers, but these are the most common things to look out for:
-[c][ffff00]High gravity[-][/c]. A good rule of thumb is you need 10m/s down thrust for each 1G of gravity on a planet with no atmosphere. Check your ship's thrust values in the statistics page of the control panel while in orbit and compare it to the planet's listed gravity. Atmospheric density can help provide extra lift to counteract gravity while your ship is in motion.
-[c][ffff00]Temperature and radiation[-][/c]. Some locations can have extreme temperatures or radiation. This can be offset with armor or armor boosters, consumables, medication, or by staying inside your ship as much as possible.
-[c][ffff00]Dangerous enemies[-][/c]. Some planets can have unique enemies that pose a serious risk to you or your ship. Check the planet description for any hints and approach unfamiliar enemies with caution.
-[c][ffff00]Low visibility[-][/c]. Some planets can have low or no visibility, even when using night vision.

A planet or sector usually lists an estimated difficulty level in the description, based on how hard a location is due to factors such as enemies, hazards, or other challenges present.
[i]This is different from the difficulty level listed on the right hand side of the screen and is a more accurate estimate of how hard a location will actually be.[/i]
[i][/i]-[c][00ffff]Beginner[-][/c]. This location is extremely easy. While it can still have hostile POIs, it's often lacking in dangerous wildlife or patrolling drones.
-[c][00ff00]Easy[-][/c]. This location is fairly easy, with low enemy density or difficulty and few environmental hazards.
-[c][ffff00]Medium[-][/c]. This location can have standard enemies and POIs that pose a challenge and some environmental hazards that can be dealt with using basic equipment. Shields recommended.
-[c][ff0000]Hard[-][/c]. This location can have enemies or environmental hazards that pose a significant challenge even to experienced players. Advanced equipment and T2 shields strongly recommended.
-[c][ff00ff]Ultra[-][/c]. This location is extremely difficult and often has unique challenges to overcome even for advanced players. The best equipment and T2 shields is strongly recommended.
-[c][ff00ff]Ultra+[-][/c], [c][ff00ff]++[-][/c], and [c][ff00ff]+++[-][/c]. This location is an end game boss encounter designed for a group of players and may be extremely difficult if not impossible.
Here you will find advice on how to survival your starting planet and work your way up to a warp capable Capital Vessel that can explore the galaxy.

Find your contact at one of the gambling tables in a Syndicate Casino. Syndicate Casinos are most often found around G, F, and A class star systems in neutral or pirate territory, and show up on the solar system map as a green space station.

You can access the hotel through one of the elevators located in the main lobby.
Syndicate Casinos are located around G, F, or A class star systems in neutral or Pirate territory.
If you lose the package you can speak to the contact at the gambling table again.
You have a new message. Check the Zirax tab of your PDA.

[c][00ff00]To the pesky Terran, [-][/c][c][00ff00]Greetings.[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]I am a representative of the Syndicate. You have been a thorn in our side for long enough now. I do salute you on your success so far. You have been quite effective at freeing the prisoners but your little heroics are now at an end.[-][/c]
[c][00ff00][-][/c]
[c][00ff00]We could use someone with your skills. Look for one of the gambling masters at a Syndicate Casino in a G, F, or A class star system. Tell him The Raven sings at midnight. He will give you a small package. Deliver it to the individual in Room 4 in the hotel area of the Casino. Don't ask any questions. I will contact you again once the job is complete.[-][/c]
[c][00ff00][-][/c]
[c][00ff00]Ignore our request at your own peril.[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]You work for the Syndicate now.[-][/c]

[c][ff0000]Wanted dead or alive[-][/c] [c][ffffff]for stealing from the Syndicate vault.[-][/c]\n[c][00ff00]Last known locations:[-][/c][c][ffffff] Hiding out in a Smuggler's Hideout on a Desert Storm or Rocky Desert planet, or part of an expedition to loot an abandoned tomb on a Desert Oasis planet.[-][/c]

[c][ff0000]Wanted dead or alive[-][/c] [c][ffffff]for breaking his contract with the Syndicate to develop new weapons.[-][/c]\n[c][00ff00]Last known locations:[-][/c][c][ffffff] Serving as an engineer on board a UCH Research Vessel.[-][/c]
[c][ff0000]Wanted dead or alive[-][/c] [c][ffffff]for not paying his debts.[-][/c]\n[c][00ff00]Last known locations:[-][/c][c][ffffff] Hiding out in an orbital Smuggler Outpost.[-][/c]

[c][ff0000]Wanted dead or alive[-][/c] [c][ffffff]for voting to increase patrols that interfere with our weapon smuggling.[-][/c]\n[c][00ff00]Last known locations:[-][/c][c][ffffff] Last seen in a room at an Argent Trade Station or Argent HQ on an Ice planet, or in a Deluxe Resort on a Tropical planet in Trading Guild territory.[-][/c]
Open and then close your PDA to read the new message.
You were sent a new message. Open and then close your PDA to view it.

[c][00ff00]To the Pesky Terran,[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]I have been informed that the individual in question has suffered an unfortunate incident involving an overloading power conduit in his room. No doubt any investigation will rule it an unavoidable accident and will not be traced back to us. A job well done and a lesson learned to all others who fail to pay off their gambling debt.[-][/c]
[c][00ff00][-][/c]
[c][00ff00]However, there are more targets that need eliminating. I have uploaded data on each target's last known location to your PDA. Open up the mission and select a target to learn more about their last known location. This may require more effort on your part to track them down. No doubt they know we are after them.[-][/c]
[c][00ff00][-][/c]
[c][00ff00]Make sure to take them out quietly. You wouldn't want to draw attention to yourself and make an enemy out of the other factions, would you? Or go in guns blazing. I don't care as long as you get results.[-][/c]
[c][00ff00]Don't think just because you took out one indebted gambler that this makes up for all the trouble you've caused us. You're in this for the long haul.[-][/c]

You have eliminated all the targets but have not received any further instruction. Perhaps they feel your debt has been repayed?\nYou have a feeling this won't be the last time you'll find yourself working for the Syndicate.

Dark Matter is a very rare end game crafting component extracted from Voidium. You must unlock it in the Progenitor Research section of your tech tree before you can extract it.

To extract it you will need an Advanced Constructor and a cargo bay large enough to store the required amount of Voidium. The process takes quite some time.

Dark Matter can be stored in two forms: A smaller Dark Matter Container that can be used to construct smaller devices or personal equipment, and a larger Dark Matter Pod used in larger devices such as those for capital vessels.
Dark Matter Containers can also be rarely found as loot, though the chances of this are slim.
This section explains what UCH knows about Voidium

Voidium is a very rare end game resource found growing in large crystal formations on some planets.
You will need a Voidium Extractor or Voidium Drill to harvest it, unlocked in the Progenitor Research tab of your tech tree.

Voidium contains trace amounts of Dark Matter and can be extracted through a lengthy process.
Voidium is extremely massive and takes up a lot of room. Ensure you have a ship capable of hauling it before harvesting.

Progenitor Technology Fragments are a rare end game crafting component used in Progenitor technology. To build a Voidium Extractor you will need Progenitor Technology Fragments.\n\nWhile it's unclear where to get these fragments, you might start by speaking with the Lead Researcher on board a UCH Research Vessel as they are currently studying the Progenitors.

[c][ffff00]WARNING:[-][/c] Entering a [u]HIGH RISK[/u] zone. New Empyriopedia section unlocked in PDA [c][ffff00]({keybind(PDA)})[-][/c]:\n"[c][00ffff]Project Eden:[-][/c] [c][ffffff]Corrupted Encounters[-][/c]"

Rarely in N or BH class star systems you can encounter ships that have traveled outside the galaxy only to be transformed and returned. Their hulls have been twisted, infused with alien materials and augmented with terrifying new weapons and nearly impenetrable shields.


These ships are not to be engaged except by the bravest, or stupidest, individuals. To face one in combat is almost certain death, but they are there, watching, waiting, with unknown purpose.
This section explains what UCH knows about Corrupted Encounters.

[c][ffff00]You might have noticed some items in the tech tree require a lot of points to unlock.[-][/c]\n\nAfter level 25, you will continue to earn unlock points from doing missions, turning in Data Pads from alien loot containers, performing research under the Project Eden Research mission, and turning in Data Chips from hacking.
This section explains what UCH knows about Unlock Points.
[c][ffffff]This explains where to do the default story missions.[-][/c]

[c][ffffff]The default missions (or Reforged Galaxy missions if you're playing that) can be completed on the planet, moon, or orbits of Haven, Gaia, Persephone, Akua, Omicron, Roggery, or Ningues, and in the starting systems of Alpha and Beta.
There are also 6 solar systems nearby the starting solar systems for the default missions. Each mission system will have a unique name, for example Sigma Zero. Simply search the galaxy map for the system name referenced in the mission description.

Check the description of each starting planet to see what missions, if any, they have.[-][/c]
Intro: Welcome to a new World

You find yourself stranded on an alien world. Find a way to survive and eventually travel to space.\nMain story missions are not available on this planet. More information can be found in the [c][00ffff]Empyriopedia[-][/c]. Open your PDA with [c][ffff00]({keybind(PDA)}) [-][/c]to clear this message.

[c][ffffff]UCH Researchers are looking for field researchers to assist with studying the Andromeda galaxy.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]If you bring them a[-][/c] [c][00ff00]research report[-][/c][c][ffffff] they can provide you with unlock points.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]
[c][ffffff]You can create research reports from various materials in the [-][/c][c][00ff00]decoration tab[-][/c][c][ffffff] of a small, large, or advanced constructor.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]With the research report in your personal inventory and this mission active, use the research computer in the lab of a UCH Research Vessel.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]You can sometimes find UCH Research Vessels in habitable systems in neutral territory. They show up on the solar system map as a blue triangle.

Research will give unlock points based on the report that is turned in and can be repeated every 3 hours.[-][/c]
[i][c][ffff00]The UCHN Discovery, Explorer, Odyssey, and Pathfinder in the starting systems do not have research computers.[-][/c][/i]
[i][c][ffff00]You can turn in research reports to each research vessel only once.[-][/c][/i]
You have completed the research and gained additional knowledge.\nYou may perform research at a different research vessel in 3 hours.
Create a research report and place it in your personal inventory.\nFind a UCH Research Vessel and access the computer in the research lab.

[c][ffffff]UCH Researchers are looking for field researchers to assist with studying the Andromeda galaxy.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]If you bring them a[-][/c] [c][00ff00]research report[-][/c][c][ffffff] they can provide you with unlock points.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][-][/c]
[c][ffffff]You can create research reports from various materials in the [-][/c][c][00ff00]decoration tab[-][/c][c][ffffff] of a small, large, or advanced constructor.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]With the research report in your personal inventory and this mission active, use the research computer in the lab of a UCH Research Vessel.[-][/c]
[c][ffffff]You can sometimes find UCH Research Vessels in habitable systems in neutral territory. They show up on the solar system map as a blue triangle.

Research will give unlock points based on the report that is turned in and can be repeated every 3 hours.[-][/c]
[i][c][ffff00]The UCHN Discovery, Explorer, Odyssey, and Pathfinder in the starting systems do not have research computers.[-][/c][/i]

[c][00ffff][b]Location:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Andromeda Galaxy[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Difficulty:[/b][-][/c] [c][00ff00]Easy[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Repeatable:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]No[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Objectives:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Visit the habitable star systems of the Andromeda Galaxy[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][i]You must warp to the star systems. Starting systems do not count towards credit.[/i][-][/c]

Once you have a capital vessel capable of warping and a good supply of Pentaxid, you can go out into the galaxy and begin surveying different star classes. Start with the more sun-like habitable systems.
You will also need to bring along a good supply of Basic System Survey Probes. You can build probes in the Deco tab of small, large, or advanced constructors.

[c][00ff00]You can search for stars of a specific star class on the galaxy map by selecting [-][/c][c][ffff00]Search System[-][/c][c][00ff00] at the bottom, then typing a [-][/c][c][ffff00]star class[-][/c][c][00ff00] in the [-][/c][c][ffff00]Type[-][/c][c][00ff00] box in the search window.[-][/c]
For example you can search for G, G2, G3, K, N, etc.
[i][c][ffffff]For these missions only the exact star class listed will complete an objective (a G3 star does not count as a G) and searching the galaxy by star type only finds exact matches (searching for G stars will not show G3 stars)[-][/c][/i]
[c][ffffff][i][/i][-][/c]We will keep in touch as you explore via long range communications.
Basic System Survey Probe on toolbar
Place a Basic Systems Probe on your toolbar to launch the probe.\nBasic System Probes can be crafted in the Deco tab of a Small or better base or cv Constructor.
Wait for the survey to complete.

[c][00ffff][b]Location:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Andromeda Galaxy[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Difficulty:[/b][-][/c] [c][00ff00]Easy[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Repeatable:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]No[-][/c]
[c][00ffff][b]Objectives:[/b][-][/c] [c][ffffff]Visit the habitable star systems of the Andromeda Galaxy[-][/c]
[c][ffffff][i]You must warp to the star systems. Starting systems do not count towards credit.[/i][-][/c]

Once you have a capital vessel capable of warping and a good supply of Pentaxid, you can go out into the galaxy and begin surveying different star classes. Start with the more sun-like habitable systems.
You will also need to bring along a good supply of Basic System Survey Probes. You can build probes in the Deco tab of small, large, or advanced constructors.

[c][00ff00]You can search for stars of a specific star class on the galaxy map by selecting [-][/c][c][ffff00]Search System[-][/c][c][00ff00] at the bottom, then typing a [-][/c][c][ffff00]star class[-][/c][c][00ff00] in the [-][/c][c][ffff00]Type[-][/c][c][00ff00] box in the search window.[-][/c]
For example you can search for G, G2, G3, K, N, etc.
[i][c][ffffff]For these missions only the exact star class listed will complete an objective (a G3 star does not count as a G) and searching the galaxy by star type only finds exact matches (searching for G stars will not show G3 stars)[-][/c][/i]

We will keep in touch as you explore via long range communications.

Find any variation of a G class star system on the galaxy map and warp to it. They appear as a medium yellow star.\nYou will also need an ample supply of survey probes built in the Deco tab of a constructor.\n[c][00ff00]You can use the galaxy map to search by star type (example G, G2, G3, etc)[-][/c]
Place a Basic System Survey Probe on your toolbar to begin the survey.

[c][00ffff]UCH Research Vessel: [-][/c]Survey in progress. Please stand by.\nWhen you warp to a star you end up in a warp arrival sector. You cannot warp to these normally so getting back can be hard. Don't leave anything behind!
Warp to a G class star system.\n[c][00ff00]You can use the galaxy map to search by star type (example G, G2, G3, etc)[-][/c]
Basic System Survey Probe on toolbar
Place a Basic Systems Probe on your toolbar to launch the probe.\nBasic System Probes can be crafted in the Deco tab of a Small or better base or cv Constructor.
Place a Basic System Survey Probe on your toolbar to begin the survey.
Wait for the survey to complete.

[c][00ffff]UCH Research Vessel: [-][/c]G class star systems seem to be the most hospitable so far. A wide variety of temperate, desert, and snow planets can probably be found in systems such as these.

Wait for the survey to complete.

You have completed a survey of the more common habitable star systems in the Andromeda galaxy.\nHabitable systems such as G, F, and A class have an abundance of life giving worlds and a heavy civilian presence. They make good places to farm and trade.\nYou have compiled the data you've obtained into navigational data that can be used to increase your maximum warp range.
Wait while you compile the survey reports

Find a M class star system on the galaxy map and warp to it. M class stars appear on the map as a small red star.\nYou will also need an ample supply of Standard System Survey Probes built in the Deco tab of a constructor.\nNote: starter systems do not count.
